casebody.data:
Alonzo STALLINGS, Appellant,
v.
CITY OF ST. LOUIS, et al., Respondents. No. ED 106081 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION THREE. Filed: July 31, 2018 FOR APPELLANT: Richard B. Blanke, 906 Olive Street, Suite 300, St. Louis, MO 63101. FOR RESPONDENT: Erin K. McGowan, Associate City Counselor, Room 314, City Hall, 1200 Market Street, St. Louis, MO 63103. Before Gary M. Gaertner, Jr., P.J., Robert M. Clayton III, J., and Angela T. Quigless, J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Alonzo Stallings ("Stallings") appeals the judgment of the Circuit Court of the City of St. Louis affirming the decision of the Civil Service Commission ("the Commission") upholding Stallings's termination of employment as an inventory control technician in the City of St. Louis's Division of Corrections. We find the Commission's decision is not erroneous.

No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. We have, however, provided the parties a memorandum setting forth the reasons for our decision. The decision of the Commission is affirmed under Rule 84.16(b).
